Ricardo Pietrobon

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/7436075455169145
  • Última atualização do currículo em 10/02/2014

Dr. Ricardo Pietrobon possui graduação em Medicina pela Universidade Federal do Paraná (1995). PhD pela University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill (EUA) e MBA pela FUQUA/DUKE University (EUA). Atualmente é Associate Vice Chair e Associate Professor, Departamento de Cirurgia - Duke University Medical Center (EUA). Tem experiência na área de Medicina, com ênfase em Cirurgia Ortopédica. Vasta experiencia em Pesquisa (Research on Research group http://researchonresearch.duhs.duke.edu). (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2011 - 2012
Cognitive dysfunction after general anesthesia
Descrição: Evaluate the effect of dexamethasone on the incidence of cognitive dysfunction in the post-operative period of elderly patients undergoing surgery under general anesthesia as well as the role of the alelle e4 for the apolipoprotein as well as biomarkers for neuronal protein S100b and the neuron-specific enolase.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Maria Jose Carmona - Integrante.
2011 - Atual
VisualDecisionLinc: Real-time Decision Support for Behavioral Health
Descrição: The proposed work will focus on: 1) developing new approaches to selecting comparative patient populations based on expert-driven, guidelines-driven, and data-driven approaches, 2) development of software user interfaces to quickly allow clinicians to determine which treatment approaches have been effective for patients similar to the presenting patient, and 3) provide an initial evaluation of approaches in preparation of a larger scale deployment and test of clinical effectiveness .
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Ketan Mane - Coordenador.
2010 - 2012
Evaluating Effectiveness and Efficiency of Conducting SR-MA on Three Clinically Significant Neurosurgical Topics, Using the Cochrane and CERR-N Methods.
Descrição: Evaluating Effectiveness and Efficiency of Conducting SR-MA on Three Clinically Significant Neurosurgical Topics, Using the Cochrane and CERR-N Methods..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Christopher Ang - Coordenador.
2009 - 2012
A New Approach to Psychiatry Focusing on our Children and Their Future
Descrição: The objective of this study to create strategies that promote mental health and protect the vulnerable and at-risk individuals. Mental disorders frequently begin in childhood. With this in mind, we have designed our project to provide a new framework for psychiatry in Brazil: developmental psychiatry..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Euripedes Constantino Miguel Filho - Coordenador.
2009 - 2011
Metabolomics Network for Drug Response Phenotype.
Descrição: Antihypertensives and anti-platelet therapy are major classes of therapies used for the treatment and prevention of CVD. Controlling blood pressure and preventing platelet aggregation are major contributors toward reducing CVD events. While these therapies have demonstrated a remarkable degree of consistency in their ability to reduce risk for both CVD and stroke, residual CVD risk remains high, and potential drug-related adverse events are significant concerns. A deeper understanding of pathways implicated in variation in response could lead to more effective approaches for preventing and treating CVD and could result in personalized drug therapy..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Rima Kaddurah-Daouk - Coordenador.
2009 - 2011
Metabolomics Network for Drug Response Phenotype
Descrição: Antihypertensives and anti-platelet therapy are major classes of therapies used for the treatment and prevention of CVD. Controlling blood pressure and preventing platelet aggregation are major contributors toward reducing CVD events. While these therapies have demonstrated a remarkable degree of consistency in their ability to reduce risk for both CVD and stroke, residual CVD risk remains high, and potential drug-related adverse events are significant concerns. A deeper understanding of pathways implicated in variation in response could lead to more effective approaches for preventing and treating CVD and could result in personalized drug therapy..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Rima Kaddurah-Daouk - Coordenador.
2009 - 2011
NIH - Neurosurgery Research and Education Foundation (Reynolds)
Descrição: The overall significance of this project is relevant to Singapore context in quantifying equivalence of Qol instruments in various languages, and comparability of resilts from heterogenous population subgourps. This is especially relevant in a multi-racial society such as Singapore s..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Julian Thumboo - Coordenador.
2009 - 2010
NINDS Research Education Programs for Residents and Fellows in Neurosurgery T-regulatory cell fractions in Medulloblastoma Patients undergoing Standard Therapy and Their Response to Daclizumab
Descrição: The overall goal of this translational and clinical research training program is to ensure that a diverse group of residents and fellows in the clinical neurosciences become highly-trained clinician-scientists with sufficient knowledge of clinical investigation principles and regulations to become competent, responsible, and independently-funded investigators capable of translating basic discoveries into clinical practice..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / John H Sampson - Coordenador.
2009 - 2010
DADOS-Prospective
Descrição: DADOS-Prospective.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Coordenador.
2009 - 2009
Computerized Interactive Assessment of Functional Skills for Schizophrenia Drug Trials
Descrição: The major goal of this project is to develop a computerized measure of functional capacity to be used in schizophrenia drug trials as a co-primary measure of cognition..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Kolleen Hurley - Coordenador.
2008 - 2012
USA-Brazil consortium for education in biomedical informatics
Descrição: The objective is to Enhance BioMedical Informatics Education: Training in Development, Deployment, and Optimal use of Electronic Health Record Systems to Improve Healthcare Outcomes .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Coordenador.
2008 - Atual
Vulnerability, Disease Progression, and Treatment in Schizophrenia and Related Psychoses
Descrição: The overall objective of this TCR Neuroscience Flagship Programme is to identify key genetic, biological, cognitive, clincial and social risk factors for psychotic disorders, and to establish the efficacy and safety of a neurocognitive-enhancing agent for patients with schizophrenia. .
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Chong Siow Ann - Coordenador.
2007 - 2009
International Perioperative Genetics and Safety Outcomes Study in Cardiac Surgery (iPEGASUS)
Descrição: The objective of this application is to support the infrastructure of the international Perioperative Genetics and Safety Outcome Study ( i PEGASUS), a global consortium of anesthesiology investigators who have come together in order to improve our understanding of the role of genetic variation in the response to surgery..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Myles - Coordenador / Andrew Shaw - Integrante.
2007 - 2009
Psychophysiological Bases of Risk Taking and Cognition Under Stress
Descrição: The objective of this trial is the Military Operational Risk Taking Scale (MORTS) will be developed and validated by our collaborative laboratory at Duke University Medical Center in Durham, NC, under the direction of Co-PI, Ricardo Pietrobon, MD, PhD. Questions will be generated to distinguish between adaptive and maladaptive risk taking behavior in the military domain. Military subjects recruited out of the San Diego area will be directed to the website to complete the questionnaire online. Dr. Pietrobon s laboratory will then apply factor analytic techniques to determine the factor structure of the scale, and normative data will also be generated. Convergent and discriminant validity will be determined, and reliability analyses will be performed..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Marcus K Taylor - Coordenador.
2007 - 2009
NIDCD Phased Infrastructure for Patient-Oriented Research CHEER Network: Creating Healthcare Excellence through Education and Research
Descrição: The major goal of this project is to create a cohort of patients with otolaryngology procedures to evaluate patient outcomes and patient safety, and develop and implement infrastructure for a national, practice-based clinical research network called "Creating Healthcare Excellence through Education and Research" (CHEERS).
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / David Witsell - Coordenador.
2007 - 2008
Computer Simulation for the Optimization of Randomized Controlled Trial Performance
Descrição: The objective of this study is to design a computer simulation that will model the performance of future randomized controlled trials based on historical data compiled from prior studies. With the recent expansion of contract research organizations in nations such as Brazil and India, we are particularly interested in also exploring whether, in fact, there are cost and study performance benefits of co-hosting large RCTs overseas with such organizations. .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Stephen Klein - Coordenador.
2007 - 2008
Obesity and Nocturnal Oxygenation after Ambulatory Surgery
Descrição: The objective of this prospective cohort study is to examining whether body mass index (normal, morbidly obese) increases the incidence of nocturnal hypoxemia in patients undergoing ambulatory laparoscopic surgery. Using preoperative and postoperative ambulatory respiratory physiology monitoring the study will quantify the frequency, duration and degree of hypopnea and hypoxemia and correlate it with current scoring tools so that objective data will exist to make safe decisions to care for this growing segment of the population..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Stephen Klein - Coordenador.
2006 - 2011
Pharmacometabolmics Research Network - Metabolomics Network for Drug Response Phenotype
Descrição: The current application is specifically designed to integrate metabolomics and pharmacogenomics to achieve a deeper understanding of the drug-response phenotype and to accelerate the establishment of genotype-phenotype correlations for drug response..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Rima Kaddurah-Daouk - Coordenador.
2006 - 2011
Geriatric Database Development
Descrição: The objective of this study is to customize QuestForm for the storage of information on several geriatric databases, therefore justifying the label of "database of databases". This would be a central resource that will allow geriatric researchers to search for, in a single location, information on a large number of geriatric databases with special attention to issues of functional decline.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Harvey J Cohen - Coordenador.
2006 - 2008
Role of Intra-Operative Intracapsular Blocks in Post-Operative Pain Management following Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Double-Blinded Randomized Controlled Trial
Descrição: Role of Intra-Operative Intracapsular Blocks in Post-Operative Pain Management following Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Double-Blinded Randomized Controlled Trial.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Michael P Bolognesi - Coordenador.
2006 - 2008
Core Resources: CTSI/Biomedical Informatics
Descrição: The major goal is to create a clinical and translational research effort at Duke University to promote high quality standards in clinical research practice..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Robert Califf - Coordenador.
2006 - 2007
Real-time updates of Meta-Analyses of treatment of low back pain supported by a biomedical ontology - American Academy of Orthopaedic Manual Physical Therapists.a
Descrição: The purpose of the grant was to provide the extension and validation of a real-time, meta-analytic software program that allows real-time analysis of trial data in absence of the complete data set and to provide real time updates on the JMMT website. .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Chad Cook - Coordenador.
2006 - 2007
Identification of factors that enhance career satisfaction among practicing female emergency medicine physicians
Descrição: The purpose of the grant was to provide the extension and validation of a real-time, meta-analytic software program that allows real-time analysis of trial data in absence of the complete data set and to provide real time updates on the JMMT website..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Kathleen Clem - Coordenador.
2006 - 2007
Project V.I.D.A. (Elderly and Deficient Actively Live)
Descrição: The objective of this trial is the development of equipments, tecnics and metods to provide a better quality of life to Elderly and Deficient people. .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Lilian Teresa Bucken Gobbi - Coordenador.
2005 - 2006
Scientific Writing Workshop using On-line Instructional Technology
Descrição: The objective of this proposal is to conduct a randomized controlled trial comparing regular education of novice researchers against the use of the Manuscript Architect application.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
2005 - 2006
Bioterrorism Training and Curriculum Development Program
Descrição: The objective of this study was to design a comprehensive evaluation for a disaster intervention, including the design and validation of outcome scales evaluating teamwork in disaster environments.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Victoria S Kaprielian - Coordenador.
2004 - 2007
The Role of Dexamethasone and Anesthesia Depth in the Incidence of Postoperative Cognitive Dysfunction: - A Factorial Randomized Controlled Trial
Descrição: The objective of this trial is to compare the role of deep versus light anesthesia and preoperative intra-venous dexamethasone in the prevention of postoperative cognitive dysfunction after ambulatory procedures in the elderly .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Karen C Nielsen - Coordenador.
2004 - 2006
Linking Scores of the DASH and modified ASES scales: A prospective study
Descrição: The objective of this study is to create a linkage between the DASH and modified American Surgeon and Elbow classification so that patients scored using different scales can have their outcomes compared using a common metric. .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Coordenador.
2004 - 2004
Obesity and nocturnal oxygenation after ambulatory surgery
Descrição: The goal of this project is to evaluate the association between body mass index and oxygen desaturation after ambulatory surgery procedures.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Stephen Klein - Coordenador.
2004 - 2004
The impact of comorbidities in the outcomes of patients undergoing total shoulder replacement
Descrição: The objective of this grant is to evaluate the impact of comorbidities in the outcomes of patients undergoing total shoulder replacement based on a large national sample representative of all procedures conducted in the US between 1988 and 2000..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Coordenador.
2004 - 2004
Validation of outcome measures for functional evaluation of patients with cervical spondylotic myelopathy
Descrição: The goal of this study is to conduct a prospective cohort to serve as a pilot for a future randomized controlled trial comparing conservative versus surgical treatment with a diagnosis of cervical spondylotic myelopathy.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Turner, D - Coordenador.
2004 - 2004
Medical Student Summer Research Preceptorship
Descrição: The goal of this study is to identify whether there is a definitive relationship between the volume of shoulder surgeries performed by a surgeon and his or her outcomes. In addition, grant money is awarded in order for the principal investigator to learn about the practice of rheumatology.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Integrante / Neeti Bathia - Coordenador.
2003 - 2003
The integration of patient-reported and clinician-obtained data via scannable for into the Physical Therapy and Medical Record: The First Step in Evidence-Based Practice.
Descrição: To develop a system for data collection in the Sports Medicine Clinic at Duke University .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Coordenador.
2003 - 2003
Linking scores on the Sickness Impact Profile and Short-Form Musculoskeletal Assessment Scales: A prospective study
Descrição: The goal of this study is to link the Sickness Impact Profile and Short Musculoskeletal Function Assessment questionnaires using Item Response Theory .
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Ricardo Pietrobon - Coordenador.
